summary: The Accelerating the Development of Advanced Psychology Trainees Act (ADAPT Act) aims to expand access to psychological mental and behavioral health services for Medicare, Medicaid, and CHIP beneficiaries.  It permits reimbursement for services provided by supervised psychology trainees (doctoral interns and postdoctoral residents) and requires the Secretary of Health and Human Services to develop a billing code to identify these services within one year of enactment.  The bill also mandates guidance to states on strategies to cover trainee services under Medicaid and CHIP.
